style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">Movies vs. TV</span><br /><br />You decide to enter a contest run by the local movie theater.&nbsp; All you have to do is write a great essay about why it is better to go out to the movie theater than to stay home and watch TV.<br /><br />You know that a thesis statement is important.&nbsp; You really do believe that going to the movies is better than staying home and watching TV.&nbsp; You did some brainstorming in the mini-lesson <em>Generating Ideas</em>, and came up with three reasons why it is better to go out to the movies than sit at home watching TV.<br /><br />Now you need to know how to turn those reasons&nbsp;into a strong thesis statement.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Essay<br /><span style=\"font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 22.5px; time.</p><p><span class=\"marker\">How do I make these ideas into a strong thesis statement??</span><br />&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"1","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"2"},"leftText":"<p>The <strong>thesis statement</strong> is part of your first paragraph.&nbsp; It tells what you believe and provides the framework for the rest of the essay.&nbsp; It gives your reader information about what you will cover in your writing.&nbsp; The thesis statement</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>states your topic.</li><li>provides a framework for your essay and lets the reader know what you will say about the topic.</li><li>is focused.</li><li>is specific.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul>","rightText":null,"headerText":"What is a thesis statement?"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"3"},"leftText":"<p>The first part of your thesis statement names your topic.&nbsp; This is what you are writing about.&nbsp;<br /><br />Suppose you are writing about the work habits of a good student.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\"><strong>Topic:</strong></span></p><p>A good student. . .</p>","headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"leftText":"<p>The next part of your thesis statement includes a plan for how you will develop your topic.<br /><br />To let your reader know your plan for writing, you can include your three big ideas or reasons that you plan to write about.&nbsp; Each one will become the subject&nbsp;of one of your body paragraphs.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic:</span></p><p>A good student<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Plan for development: </span></p><p>organizes her time; asks questions as needed; and learns from mistakes.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement:</span></p><p>A good student organizes her time; asks questions as needed; and learns from mistakes.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"5"},"leftText":"<p>Suppose you are writing about the benefits of cooking classes in public schools.<br /><br />Think about the topic and your plan for development, and then put them together to form the thesis statement.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic: </span></p><p>Cooking classes in public schools<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Plan for development:</span></p><p>teach kids math; teach kids about nutrition; and teach a valuable survival skill.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement:</span></p><p>Cooking classes in public schools teach kids math; they teach kids about nutrition; and they teach a valuable survival skill.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<p>When you write about the three ideas from the thesis statement in the body of your essay, you will introduce them in the same order as they occur in your thesis statement.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td colspan=\"3\" style=\"text-align:center;\">Thesis statement contains three main /></p><p>Paragraph #2</p></td><td><p>Idea #3<img alt=\"connects to\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p><p>Paragraph #3</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"leftText":"<p>If your essay is sharing information about a particular topic (a <strong>descriptive </strong>essay), your thesis statement will name the three categories you plan to write about.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic:</span></p><p>Taking a vacation in New York City<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Three categories you plan to write about:</span></p><p>you can explore historic sites, sample food from all over the world, and spend time shopping in stores of all sizes.</p>","headerText":"Types of thesis statements"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<p>If your essay is trying to convince your reader that your ideas are correct&nbsp;(a <strong>persuasive</strong> essay), the thesis statement will clearly state your opinion&nbsp;and three reasons to support what you believe.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic:</span></p><p>Online classes<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Opinion:</span></p><p>are preferable to face-to-face classes<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Reasons to support your opinion:</span></p><p>they let students work at any time of the day; they may include students from diverse geographic areas; and they allow a wider group of people an opportunity to get an education.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"9"},"leftText":"<p>Sometimes a thesis statement can look slightly different.<br /><br />When you are telling a story (a<strong> narrative</strong> essay), you may choose to create a thesis statement that gives the reader a hint of what is to come in your story without giving away the whole story.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement:</span></p><p>Little did I know that this dark, rainy day would end up to be the happiest day of my life.</p><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">or</span></p><p>When my parents went on vacation and left me in charge of the house, asking a few friends over to keep me company seemed like a good idea.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"10"},"leftText":"<p>A thesis statement should be <strong>focused.</strong><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Too vague:</span></p><p><em>Gone with the Wind </em>is one of the greatest American movie&nbsp;classics.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Try this:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Add reasons that make this movie a classic.</span></p><p>The film,&nbsp;<em>Gone with the Wind, </em>has a compelling plot, unforgettable characters, and dramatic sets that all contribute to make it an American movie classic.</p>","headerText":"Writing an effective thesis statement"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"11"},"leftText":"<p>A thesis statement should be <strong>specific.</strong><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Too broad:</span></p><p>Gardening includes many tasks.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Try this:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">Create a sentence that names the tasks that are part of gardening.</span></p><p>Gardening tasks include maintaining the lawn, caring class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement with a plan for writing:</span></p><p>The characteristics of a good teacher include expertise in the What reasons will convince others that your opinion is right?<br /><br />You can use the brainstorming techniques from the mini-lesson on <em>Generating Ideas</em> to develop your opinion and your supporting reasons.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Opinion:</span></p><p>Going to the movies is better than staying home and watching TV.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Reasons:</span></p><p>There are no distractions at the movies.</p><p>The audiovisual experience is better.</p><p>It is a more active use of my time.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"18"},"leftText":"<p>Now you can put your thesis statement together.&nbsp;<br /><br />Name your topic,&nbsp;state your opinion, and list the three reasons in order of importance, from least important to most important.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Thesis statement with topic and reasons:</span></p><p>Going to the movies is better than staying home because there are no distractions or interruptions at the movies; the audio and visual experiences are more intense at the movies; and making the effort to get out and go to a movie theater is a more active use of my time.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"19"},"rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Does it include your topic?</span></p><p>Yes<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Is it focused?</span></p><p>Yes!&nbsp; The statement explains reasons why going out to a theater is better than staying home.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Is it specific without being too narrow?</span></p><p>Yes!&nbsp; The reasons listed are neither too narrow nor too broad.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Does it let the reader know your plan for writing?</span></p><p>The statement lets the reader know three reasons that you will discuss in the body of the essay.</p>","leftText":"<p>Is this a strong thesis statement?<br /><br />Remember you may decide to revise your thesis statement later.&nbsp;
